organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Jeff Gordon turned a lap at 96.228 miles an hour on the 0.526-mile Martinsville Speedway oval, the oldest, shortest and trickiest in Nascar’s Spring Cup Series, to beat Denny Hamlin (95.757) easily for his seventh career Martinsville pole and the 65th of his career over all, the fourth-best total in Nascar history. Only Richard Petty (126), David Pearson (112) and Cale Yarborough (70) have won more Nascar poles.
